[et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ admin_label=”Banner” module_class=”torn-edge” _builder_version=”4.9.6″ _module_preset=”default” use_background_color_gradient=”on” background_color_gradient_start=”rgba(223,217,191,0.76)” background_color_gradient_end=”rgba(0,0,0,0)” background_color_gradient_overlays_image=”on” background_image=”http://thelightproject.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/Banner_schools.jpg” background_position=”top_center” custom_margin=”||||false|false”][et_pb_row use_custom_gutter=”on” gutter_width=”1″ _builder_version=”4.9.4″ _module_preset=”default” background_enable_color=”off” z_index=”2″ max_width_phone=”100%” max_width_last_edited=”off|desktop” custom_margin=”15vh||15vh||true|false” custom_margin_tablet=”8vh||8vh||true|false” custom_margin_phone=”0vh||0vh||true|false” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_padding=”||||false|false” module_alignment_tablet=”left” module_alignment_phone=”center” module_alignment_last_edited=”off|desktop” custom_margin__hover_enabled=”off|hover”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.9.4″ _module_preset=”default”][et_pb_text module_class=”opening-header-short” _builder_version=”4.9.6″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color=”#333333″ header_text_color=”#333333″ header_font_size=”77px” header_font_size_tablet=”70px” header_font_size_phone=”44px” header_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone”]

Schools

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ _builder_version=”3.22″ custom_padding=”54px|0px|0|0px|false|false”][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.9.6″ custom_padding=”27px|0px|0|0px|false|false” custom_width_px=”980px”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text admin_label=”Intro Title” _builder_version=”4.9.6″ text_font=”||||||||” text_text_color=”#4b858e” header_font=”|||on|||||” header_text_color=”#4b858e” header_2_font=”|300|||||||” header_3_font=”Zooja Pro|100|||||||” header_3_text_align=”left” header_3_text_color=”#cccdce” header_3_font_size=”82px” header_3_letter_spacing=”-0.1px” header_3_line_height=”1.1em” header_3_font_size_tablet=”” header_3_font_size_phone=”77px” header_3_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone”]

Kia ora and thank you for joining the conversation about porn and young people.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”3_4,1_4″ _builder_version=”4.9.6″ custom_padding=”27px|0px|0|0px|false|false” custom_css_before=”width: 250px;||height: 382px;||content: ”;||background-image: url(/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/Professionals-doodle-xs.png);||position: absolute;||left: -260px;||top: -20px;||background-size: cover;” custom_width_px=”980px”][et_pb_column type=”3_4″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text admin_label=”Intro Quote” _builder_version=”4.9.10″ text_font=”|300|||||||” text_text_color=”#636466″ text_font_size=”24px” text_line_height=”30px” hover_enabled=”0″ sticky_enabled=”0″]

You’re probably aware that the porn landscape for young people has changed dramatically over the last five years. It’s changed in terms of how much porn is available, its ease of access, how frequently young people watch it and the type of porn that is considered normal.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.9.10″ text_font=”|300|||||||” text_text_color=”#636466″ text_line_height=”1.5em” header_font=”||||||||” header_text_color=”#636466″ custom_margin=”||80px||false|false” hover_enabled=”0″ sticky_enabled=”0″]

Porn has now become a primary sex educator for young people(7,19), influencing youth sexual culture in new and diverse ways – which is why it’s more important than ever that schools are equipped to be part of the porn conversation with students.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text module_class=”col-quote-block” _builder_version=”4.9.6″ _module_preset=”default”]

I definitely feel like the conversation about porn should be talked about a lot more in schools and from professionals. You have like sex ed class – but you don’t talk about porn?
—NZ male, 20 yrs(47)

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”27px|0px|0|0px|false|false” custom_width_px=”980px”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text admin_label=”Intro Title” module_class=”speech-bubble4-green” _builder_version=”4.9.10″ text_font=”||||||||” text_text_color=”#ffffff” text_font_size=”20px” header_font=”||||||||” header_2_font=”Poppins||||||||” header_2_text_color=”#ffffff” header_4_font=”Poppins||||||||” header_4_text_color=”#FFFFFF” header_4_font_size=”28px” transform_rotate=”0deg|0deg|-1deg” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”-30px||12px” hover_enabled=”0″ sticky_enabled=”0″]

THE PORN INDUSTRY ISN’T GOING AWAY ANYTIME SOON…

so school leaders, teachers and staff can play an important role in helping young people navigate it, by equipping them with porn literacy skills. Sounds complicated? It’s not really… Porn literacy is simply a set of skills to help young people unpack and analyse porn. It enables them to critically examine and identify the negative messages in porn and understand how porn messaging relates to real life sexuality in terms of consent, respect, emotional connection, safety and health.

By helping young people to develop their own porn literacy, we’re equipping them with the knowledge and tools to make informed and healthy decisions around porn; minimising potential long-term harm.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ _builder_version=”3.22″ custom_padding=”45px|0px|54px|0px|false|false”][et_pb_row _builder_version=”3.25″ max_width=”980px” custom_padding=”11px|0px|27px|0px|false|false” use_custom_width=”on” custom_width_px=”980px”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text admin_label=”Intro Title” module_class=”title-light” _builder_version=”4.9.10″ text_font=”||||||||” header_font=”|300|||||||” header_2_font=”Zooja Pro|300|||||||” header_2_font_size=”46px” header_4_font=”Poppins||||||||” header_4_text_align=”center” header_4_text_color=”#4B858E” header_4_font_size=”30px” custom_margin=”30px|||” hover_enabled=”0″ sticky_enabled=”0″]

We’ve put together some resources …

to help with this based on feedback we received from New Zealand schools in a recent youth stakeholder survey: Porn and Young People – what do we know? The survey indicated that most school staff (84%) felt that porn was an issue for young people but many felt ill-equipped to engage on the issue in their workplace (25). They identified key resources they felt could be useful, and we’ve made a start on these below and if you would like to direct youth to this site, click here for a graphic to use on your social media platforms.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_3,1_3,1_3″ use_custom_gutter=”on” gutter_width=”2″ _builder_version=”4.9.6″][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”3.25″ online sexual experiences? Check out our new youth site. [/dsm_flipbox_child][/dsm_flipbox][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”3.25″][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_divider divider_position=”center” _builder_version=”3.12″ max_width=”5%”][/et_pb_divider][et_pb_text admin_label=”Intro Title” module_class=”title-light” _builder_version=”3.27.4″ text_font=”||||||||” header_font=”|300|||||||” header_2_font=”Zooja Pro|300|||||||” header_2_font_size=”46px”]Please note: we acknowledge these resources may not meet all the specific needs of some cultural or religious groups and/or sexual or gender diverse communities in New Zealand. Please feel free to tailor these resources to meet the unique needs of the communities you work with or contact us if there are other specific resources you think could be helpful. [/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ _builder_version=”4.9.4″ _module_preset=”default”][et_pb_row custom_padding_last_edited=”on|phone” module_class=”footer-quote-block” _builder_version=”4.9.4″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#F6F3EF” z_index=”2″ custom_margin=”||-15vh||false|false” custom_padding=”80px|80px|80px|80px|true|true” custom_padding_tablet=”” custom_padding_phone=”|20px|20px|20px|false|true” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-1b27fc3d-7579-4286-975a-244b5a16c6f4%22:%91%93,%22gcid-a394b62d-6ad6-4a00-840a-6f56a4918f0b%22:%91%93}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.9.4″ _module_preset=”default”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.9.6″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color=”#333333″ text_line_height=”1.9em” text_font_size_tablet=”” text_font_size_phone=”15px” text_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone”]Our silence around porn is no longer good enough, doing as it does such a grave disservice to our young people, who deserve to be guided with much more love and confidence towards a healthy and joyous expression of their sexuality.”[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.9.6″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color=”#333333″ text_font_size=”14px” text_font_size_tablet=”” text_font_size_phone=”12px” text_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone”]

— Bernard Beckett, NZ Author

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ custom_padding_last_edited=”on|desktop” _builder_version=”4.9.6″ custom_padding=”0px|0px|0px|0px” custom_padding_tablet=”” custom_padding_phone=””][et_pb_row use_custom_gutter=”on” gutter_width=”1″ _builder_version=”4.9.6″ use_background_color_gradient=”on” background_color_gradient_start=”#ffffff” background_color_gradient_end=”rgba(0,0,0,0)” background_color_gradient_end_position=”30%” background_color_gradient_overlays_image=”on” background_image=”http://thelightproject.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/BG_schools.jpg” width=”100%” width_tablet=”100%” width_phone=”” width_last_edited=”on|desktop” max_width=”100%” max_width_tablet=”100%” max_width_phone=”” max_width_last_edited=”on|desktop” height_tablet=”500px” height_phone=”500px” height_last_edited=”on|phone” make_fullwidth=”on”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_divider show_divider=”off” _builder_version=”4.9.4″ height=”800px” height_tablet=”300px” height_phone=”200px” height_last_edited=”on|phone” max_height_tablet=”300px” max_height_phone=”200px” max_height_last_edited=”on|desktop”]  [/et_pb_divider][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section]

excerpt.rendered: SchoolsKia ora and thank you for joining the conversation about porn and young people. You’re probably aware that the porn landscape for young people has changed dramatically over the last five years. It’s changed in terms of how much porn is available, its ease of access, how frequently young people watch it and the type […]
